article.title: Georgia Tech to Provide Ground-Based Sensors for Remotely Controlled Aircraft
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Georgia Tech Applied Research Corporation, Atlanta, Georgia, is being awarded a $25,135,974 cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-delivery, requirements contract for ground-based sensors for remotely controlled aircraft. ESG/PKS, Offutt Air Force Base, Nebraska, is the contracting activity.
